subtitle: Try serving this tart jelly with lamb.

method.text: Thinly peel the rind from the lemons and orange. Cut peel into very fine shreds and place in a preserving pan or large saucepan. Squeeze the juice from the fruits and add to the pan. Tie up any seeds in a small piece of muslin and add to the pan. Add the cider vinegar. Bring to boil then leave to simmer for 1 hour.

Remove the muslin bag. Add the sugar and salt. Heat gently for 3-5 min, stirring until dissolved, then bring to the boil. When it reaches a full rolling boil, boil for a further 2-3 min or until setting point is reached.
Remove from heat. Skim off any scum and leave to stand for 10 min before stirring and pouring into warmed sterilised jars. Cover with vinegar-proof lids, seal and label. Once opened, keep chilled.

title: Minted lemon jelly
